results.title: Silent speech (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A study of non-verbal communication in young children featuring the work of biologist Prof. Hubert Montagner who has discovered a correlation between the behavior of children and the attitudes of the mother toward the child. He also suggests that physiological changes in the mother - specifically the level of various hormones - are mirrored in the child. Made by British Boradcasting Corporation.

results.title: The Race to reshape cars
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Shaken by the recent fuel crisis the notoriously conservative motor industry is at last giving serious attention to the question of fuel economy. The answer they believe lies in body shapes. Horizon looks at some recent alternatives to conventional shapes from Britain, Germany and Italy.

results.title: The Mondragon experiment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Mondragon in the Basque region of Spain, is an industrial town where more than 80 factories are co-operatively owned by the workers. All this has been created with scant help from a suspicious government and no funds from stock-market investors. It has run successfully for twenty-five years. The workers run the factories and appoint the managers, run their own bank, technical college and research laboratories. In Britain, workers and management have been at loggerheads since the Industrial Revolution. Examines the feasability of Britain following the same road to prosperity. Narrated by Alexander John

results.title: The Laws of the land
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Tony Edwards
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
The application of scientific methods has increased crop and livestock yields in Britain by 50% since World War II. But some farmers are questioning the scientific approach and argue that the new methods may ultimately be self-defeating. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Traces the development of lasers and discusses their applications in the fields of medicine, dentistry, construction, communications, entertainment and welfare. Narrated by Patrick Troughton. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Killer in the village
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
An update of the 1983 Horizon report on the spread of AIDS in the United States of America and those groups most affected by the disease. Documents medical research in relation to AIDS and follows AIDS patients through various treatments. Highlights the lifestyle changes initiated in the homosexual community. Some of the ideas expressed in this video have changed in light of recent research into AIDS.

results.title: Intimate relations
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Stephen Rose
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
What makes us continue to seek long term relationships when the chances of failure are so high? American researchers interviewed hundreds of couples, married and divorced and identified the emotional pitfalls that have become the dominant causes of marital breakdown. They discuss how couples can avoid these mistakes and make intimacy the basis of a stable relationship. Narrator: Ian Holm

results.title: If at first you don't succeed: you don't succeed [Colour version]
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Edward Goldwyn and Peter Goodchild
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
If a mother does badly in bringing up her child in the first 5 years of his life, then the child has almost no chance of success in school. Child psychologists can now measure a new-born baby’s capacity for solving complex problems and they have found that the infant’s motivation is the sheer joy of solving the problems, but if the potential is not developed the damage is irreversible. The results of this research are having major implications for education.
results.title_for_label: If at first you don’t succeed: you don’t succeed [Colour version]
results.description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
If a mother does badly in bringing up her child in the first 5 years of his life, then the child has almost no chance of success in school. Child psychologists can now measure a new-born baby’s capacity for solving complex problems and they have found that the infant’s motivation is the sheer joy of solving the problems, but if the potential is not developed the damage is irreversible. The results of this research are having major implications for education.

results.title: Hello Universe
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Most scientists are convinced that extra-terrestrial life does exist, estimating that the galaxy is swarming with life. But the hard evidence is disappointingly scarce and as the search program gathers pace a different viewpoint is emerging - that after all the human race is alone in the universe. This program explores the probabilities of galactic neighbours.

results.title: Genesis (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A joint British/US program unravelling the mysteries of nature. Genesis journeys through the world of embryology to discover the intricate mechanisms by which all animal life, from insect to human, is formed.
